title: Young People (1940) xvid 1cd - Shirley Temple Films [DDR]
description:
Young People (1940) Xvid 1cd - Shirley Temple Films [DDR]

Young People is a 1940 film directed by Allan Dwan. It stars Shirley Temple and Jack Oakie
In 1940, Shirley Temple had two box-office flops in a row - The Blue Bird and Young People. She was 12 years old, but her contract said she was 11 so she could have a longer onscreen childhood. As a result of these two financial failures, Temple was no longer a top box-office star and her contract with Twentieth-Century-Fox was terminated.

    CAST:-
    Shirley Temple as Wendy Ballantine
    Jack Oakie as Joe Ballentine
    Charlotte Greenwood as Kit Ballentine
    Arleen Whelan as Judith
    George Montgomery as Mike Shea

Directed by Allan Dwan
Music by Harry Warren, Mack Gordon

Believing that it's good for their daughter Wendy (Shirley Temple), Joe Ballantine (Jack Oakie) and his wife Kit (Charlotte Greenwood) decide to retire their vaudeville act and move the family to a small New England town. But despite Wendy's many attempts to charm the locals, the "show folk" are given the cold shoulder. That is, until a hurricane hits the town, and because of the generosity, strength and conviction in the face of disaster, it appears that the troupers just might win over the residents in their new hometown after all.
